DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS SexFS v2.0 Brief Profile (Female) SFSAT101 Past 30 Days How Satisfied with Sex Life Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated response, in the past 30 days, of how satisfied they have been with their sex life, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Physical Health Domain Global Satisfaction with Sex Life Past 30 Days How Satisfied with Sex Life Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses the status of an individual's physical health._The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess self-reported perceptions of overall sexual satisfaction in men and women._A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present._A question about how satisfied an individual is or was with their sex life._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Physical Health Domain Global Satisfaction with Sex Life Subordinate Domain
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses the status of an individual's physical health.:The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess self-reported perceptions of overall sexual satisfaction in men and women.

Concepts.definition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses the status of an individual's physical health.

Concepts.longName: Global Satisfaction with Sex Life Subordinate Domain
Concepts.definition: The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess self-reported perceptions of overall sexual satisfaction in men and women.

Property.preferredName: Past 30 Days How Satisfied with Sex Life Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present.:A question about how satisfied an individual is or was with their sex life.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present.
A question about how satisfied an individual is or was with their sex life.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PROMIS:Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System, PROMIS Health Organization and PROMIS Cooperative Group, 2008-2012

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes in satisfaction ranging from 1 (Not at all) to 5 (Very).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual is not at all satisfied.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual is not at all satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual is a little satisfied.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual is a little satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual is somewhat satisfied.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual is somewhat satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual is quite satisfied.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual is quite satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating a high level of satisfaction.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating a high level of satisfaction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for Alliance per K. Laumann for PROMIS V. 2.0 Brief Profile Sexual Function and Satisfaction (Female) - smt 11/17/2021
